intro: Octomeria pubescens, commonly known as the hairy octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Octomeria pubescens produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators.
